metadata.title: School Impact Fees — SFUSD Developer Impact Fee Schedule
metadata.source: California Government Code Section 65995, SFUSD Board Resolution, SF DBI Info Sheet G-11
metadata.authority: San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) / SF Department of Building Inspection
notes: School impact fees are assessed by DBI at permit issuance based on building permit application data
Fee rates are set by SFUSD and updated periodically per state CPI adjustments
Fees are paid to the State Allocation Board (SAB) fund, not directly to SFUSD
These fees apply citywide — no neighborhood-specific variations
DBI collects the fees on behalf of SFUSD as part of the permit issuance process

fee_schedule.authority: SFUSD Board Resolution, per Government Code Section 65995(b)(3)

residential.unit: dollars per square foot of assessable space
residential.applies_to: New residential construction, additions creating new living space
residential.maximum_per_state_law: State cap per Gov Code 65995(b)(3) — adjusted biennially

commercial_industrial.unit: dollars per square foot of chargeable covered and enclosed space
commercial_industrial.applies_to: New commercial, retail, office, and industrial construction
commercial_industrial.maximum_per_state_law: State cap per Gov Code 65995(b)(3) — adjusted biennially

assessable_area.definition: All covered and enclosed space measured from exterior wall faces, excluding parking structures used exclusively for parking
includes: Hallways and corridors within the unit
excludes: Parking garages (if used exclusively for vehicle parking)

full_exemptions.condition: Structure destroyed by fire, flood, earthquake, or other disaster within prior 5 years
full_exemptions.notes: Replacement must not exceed original square footage

full_exemptions.condition: 100% affordable housing projects with deed restriction
full_exemptions.notes: Must have recorded affordability covenant; mixed-income projects: only affordable units exempt

full_exemptions.condition: Housing exclusively for seniors (62+) with recorded age restriction
Federal, state, or local government-owned facilities
Places of worship and their accessory structures

partial_exemptions.condition: Work that does not create net new assessable square footage
partial_exemptions.notes: Interior remodels that don't add area are exempt. Additions are assessed only on the new area.

partial_exemptions.condition: Accessory dwelling units may qualify for reduced or waived fees per AB 2011 / SB 13
partial_exemptions.notes: ADUs under 750 sqft are generally exempt from school impact fees per state law

steps.action: Determine assessable new square footage from building permit application
steps.notes: Net new area = proposed area - existing area (for additions/alterations)

steps.action: Classify project as residential or commercial/industrial
steps.notes: Mixed-use: each portion assessed at its respective rate

steps.action: Multiply net new square footage by applicable rate
steps.formula: Fee = Net New SF x Rate per SF

steps.notes: Exemptions require documentation (deed restrictions, age restrictions, etc.)

steps.action: Fee is collected by DBI at permit issuance
steps.notes: Fee must be paid before permit is issued. Cannot be deferred.

examples.project: Interior remodel of existing 3,000 sqft office (no area change)
examples.calculation: 0 sqft net new x $0.78 = $0 (exempt — no new area)

payment_process.when_paid: At permit issuance, before permit is released
payment_process.appeals: Disputes go to SFUSD Board; state law limits fee challenges to 90 days after levy
payment_process.refunds: If permit expires without construction, applicant may request refund from SFUSD

state_law_context.enabling_legislation: California Government Code Section 65995 et seq.
state_law_context.leroy_greene_act: SB 50 (1998) caps school fees at state-set maximums; local districts cannot exceed these
state_law_context.biennial_adjustment: State Controller adjusts maximum fee rates every 2 years based on CPI
state_law_context.preemption: State fee caps preempt any local ordinance attempting higher school fees
